class_names: PIPEWORK - SUPPORTS AND PROTECTION, ANCILLARIES TO LAYING AND EXCAVATION
metadata.description: Civil Engineering Standard Method of Measurement - Classes I, J, K, L measurement rules for drainage and pipework
metadata.australian_context: Applied to Australian civil drainage and sewer systems with AS/NZS 3725, AS/NZS 2566, AS 3500 references

excludes: Pipe supports and extras to excavation (Class L)

M1.summary: The Commencing Surface reference for pipes not in trenches
M1.application: Pipes above ground or in structures measured from defined surface

M2.summary: Backfilling of trenches shall be separate from pipe laying
M2.application: Excavation and backfill measured in Class E or L, not Class I

M3.summary: Lengths of pipes shall be laid in trenches with differentiation between categories
M3.application: Classify pipes by nominal bore, material, and trench depth

M4.summary: Additional items for extras to excavation and backfilling
M4.application: Link to Class L for rock excavation, dewatering, etc.

M5.summary: Lengths of pipes entering buildings identify separately
M5.application: Building penetrations measured as discrete items

D1.summary: Pipes not in trenches shall be classified by location/type

D2.summary: Pipes not in trenches shall be stated in item descriptions
D2.application: Full specification of support method and location

D3.summary: Depths used for classification of pipes listed in rule D1
D3.australian_note: Depth from ground level to pipe invert

A1.summary: The location or type of pipes by reference to the Drawings
A1.application: Specify pipe run, chainage, location description

A2.summary: The materials, joint types, and construction details

australian_standards.AS_NZS_3725: Design, construction and testing of water supply pipelines
australian_standards.AS_3500: Plumbing and drainage - Sanitary plumbing and drainage

A3.summary: Item descriptions for pipes in different categories
A3.application: Classify by nominal bore, material, depth category

A4.summary: The Commencing Surface and excavation reference points
A4.application: Define datum level for depth measurement

A5.summary: Where more than one pipe category exists, identify separately
A5.application: Separate items for different pipe sizes/materials in same trench

A6.summary: Trench depths exceeding standard depths require separate identification

A7.summary: Item descriptions shall state breaking up and reinstatement of roads
A7.application: Road/pavement breaking measured in Class K or L

nominal_bore_categories.typical_uses: Large trunk mains, detention basin outlets

C1.summary: Items for fittings and valves shall be measured by number
C1.application: Count all fittings and valves individually (nr)

C2.summary: Items for fittings and valves on different pipe materials
C2.application: Separate items for clay, concrete, steel, PVC, HDPE, etc.

C3.summary: Items for straight specials shall include all materials and joint types
C3.application: Prefabricated pipe assemblies with integral fittings

M1.summary: Pipe fittings comprising bends, junctions, and branches measured by number
M1.application: Each fitting is a numbered item (nr)

M2.summary: Straight specials shall be described with nominal bore and material
M2.application: Custom fabricated pipe sections with fittings

D1.summary: Pipe fittings on pipes of different materials and bores
D1.application: Classify by pipe material and nominal bore category

D2.summary: A straight special is a length of pipe with fittings or components integral to it
D2.application: Combined pipe-fitting assemblies measured as units

A1.summary: The materials, joint types, nominal bore and specification
A1.application: Full material specification matching Class I pipe

A2.summary: Item descriptions for pipe fittings classified by type and size
A2.application: Specify fitting type (bend, junction, taper) and bore size

A3.summary: Vertical bends in pipework shall be stated separately
A3.application: Distinguish vertical vs horizontal bends for access/installation

A4.summary: Fittings to pipework not in trenches requiring special identification
A4.application: Above-ground or in-structure fittings noted separately

A5.summary: Fittings to relined water services and existing pipework
A5.application: Renovation and repair fittings (Class Y overlap)

A6.summary: The materials, nominal bores, and dimensional specifications

A7.summary: Valves and penstocks to gates, filters, and control devices
A7.application: Valve type, operation method, duty rating

australian_compliance.AS_NZS_4020: Testing of products for use in contact with drinking water

coverage_rules.C1: Items for work in this class shall be separately identified
coverage_rules.C2: Items for work in this class with different pipe materials
coverage_rules.C3: Item for manholes, other chambers with type or mark numbers
coverage_rules.C4: Items for manholes with different loading duties and construction methods
coverage_rules.C5: Items for ducts and metal culverts with different cross-sections
coverage_rules.C6: Items for crossings shall identify the type of watercourse or obstruction
coverage_rules.C7: Additional reinstatement shall state depth and method
coverage_rules.C8: Removal and reinstatement of existing services and roads
coverage_rules.C9: Items for strip topsoil from easements and excavation areas
coverage_rules.C10: Items for reinstatement of field drains and marker posts

measurement_rules.M1: Excavation and pipe laying measured separately by depth category
measurement_rules.M2: The cross-sectional areas of ducts and culverts measured in square metres
measurement_rules.M3: The rules in class I for pipes applied to culvert classification
measurement_rules.M4: Crossings shall be measured by length of watercourse or obstruction
measurement_rules.M5: Crossings of streams shall be measured along pipe/duct/culvert centre lines
measurement_rules.M6: Reinstatement shall be measured by length and surface area
measurement_rules.M7: Lengths of reinstatement measured from start to finish of crossing
measurement_rules.M8: Strip topsoil from easement classed as breaking up reinstatement of roads
measurement_rules.M9: Other pipework ancillaries measured by number or length
measurement_rules.M10: The lengths measured for hedges and vegetation removal
measurement_rules.M11: The area measured for field restoration and landscape reinstatement

definition_rules.D1: The centre line for multiple pipes shall be measured from centre to centre
definition_rules.D2: The depths of manholes and chambers measured from invert to surface
definition_rules.D3: Drawpits shall be classed as chambers with specific measurement rules
definition_rules.D4: Non-circular metal culverts shall identify the nature of cross-section
definition_rules.D5: The rules in class I for pipes applied to duct classification
definition_rules.D6: River, stream and canal crossings identified by width and type of lining
definition_rules.D7: The dimension used for classification of crossings and reinstatement
definition_rules.D8: Crossings of roads and paths deemed to be included in reinstatement work

Very deep, special access equipment, safety systems

junction_chambers.measurement: By number (nr) with depth and size classification

types.australian_compliance: Road authority permits, traffic management plans

reinstatement.description: Breaking up and reinstatement of roads, paths, and surfaces

surface_types.australian_standard: AS 2758 - Aggregates and rock for engineering purposes

items.specification: Perforated pipe in gravel envelope, AS 1254

items.notes: Temporary removal during construction, full reinstatement

class_l_supports_extras.class_name: PIPEWORK - SUPPORTS AND PROTECTION, ANCILLARIES TO LAYING AND EXCAVATION

includes: Special pipe laying methods (thrust boring, pipe jacking, headings)
excludes: Pipe laying in standard conditions (Class I)

coverage_rules.C1: Items for work in this class shall be separately identified
coverage_rules.C2: Items for work in this class with different pipe materials and sizes
coverage_rules.C3: Items for special pipe laying methods (thrust boring, pipe jacking, headings)
coverage_rules.C4: Items for wrapping and lagging materials for pipes and culverts
coverage_rules.C5: Items for concrete stools and thrust blocks supporting pipes

measurement_rules.M1: Items shall be given in this class as extras to excavation
measurement_rules.M2: Work in this class associated with excavation and backfilling
measurement_rules.M3: Breaking up and removal of obstruction layers during trench excavation
measurement_rules.M4: The volume of extras to excavation calculated from nominal trench width
measurement_rules.M5: No volume of extras allowed if distance not exceeding nominal width
measurement_rules.M6: The volume of extras to excavation for rock and obstruction material
measurement_rules.M7: Backfilling above the Final Surface measured separately
measurement_rules.M8: An isolated volume of rock measured as discrete item
measurement_rules.M9: Special pipe laying methods (headings, thrust boring) measured by length
measurement_rules.M10: Access pits, shafts and removal measured by number and classification
measurement_rules.M11: Lengths of beds, haunches and surrounds measured along pipe centre lines
measurement_rules.M12: Lengths of wrapping and lagging measured along pipe length with material specification

definition_rules.D1: The nominal trench width if not stated shall be deemed standard width
definition_rules.D2: Items for haunches and surrounds defined by pipe size category
definition_rules.D3: Items for beds, haunches and surrounds classified by material type
definition_rules.D4: The volumes used for surrounds and supports measured as separate items
definition_rules.D5: The height of pipe supports measured from pipe springline to support surface
definition_rules.D6: Where two or more pipes are adjacent, calculate surrounds as composite

nominal_trench_widths.description: Standard trench widths for different pipe sizes (measured at pipe crown level)
nominal_trench_widths.australian_note: Widths per AS/NZS 2566.1 - Minimum working space requirements

categories.productivity_factor: Rock excavation typically 15-25% of standard soil excavation rate

categories.australian_standard: AS 3798 - Guidelines on earthworks for commercial and residential developments

categories.australian_compliance: EPA contaminated land regulations, waste tracking

methods.australian_note: Confined space entry requirements, ventilation, shoring

methods.equipment: Hydraulic jacking frame, auger boring machine

methods.components: Jacking pipes, intermediate jacking stations, tunnel boring machine

methods.australian_compliance: AS 2885.1 - Pipelines - Gas and liquid petroleum (for crossings)

access_pits.description: Access pits and shafts for thrust boring/jacking

size_categories.use: Pipe jacking large diameter, deep shafts

beds_haunches_surrounds.description: Pipe bedding, haunches, and surround materials
beds_haunches_surrounds.purpose: Support pipes, prevent damage, distribute loads

materials.specification: Clean sand, free of clay/organic matter, 100-150mm depth
materials.australian_standard: AS 2758.1 - Aggregates and rock for engineering purposes

materials.specification: Graded gravel 5-20mm, compacted in 150mm layers to 95% modified
C20/25 concrete, minimum 100mm below pipe, 150mm sides
materials.australian_standard: AS 1379 - Specification and supply of concrete
materials.typical_use: Heavy loads, unstable ground, large diameter pipes

materials.material: Controlled low strength material (CLSM) / flowable fill
materials.australian_note: Increasingly common in urban reinstatement projects

bedding_factors.description: Bedding factor improves pipe load-bearing capacity

factors.description: Loose sand under pipe, no haunch
Granular bed and haunch to pipe springline, compacted
Granular bed and haunch to 150mm above pipe crown, fully compacted

bedding_factors.australian_reference: AS/NZS 2566.2 - Installation of buried flexible pipes

types.specification: Hot applied bitumen or tape wrap
PE sleeve over ductile iron/steel pipe, heat shrink or loose fit
types.australian_note: Common for water mains in coastal/industrial areas

types.specification: Fusion bonded epoxy (FBE) or liquid epoxy
types.australian_standard: AS 3680 - Guide to the application of coatings to metal pipelines

types.specification: Minimum 50mm concrete cover all around pipe
types.australian_note: Used for road/rail crossings, unstable ground

thrust_blocks_supports.purpose: Resist thrust forces at bends, tees, valves; prevent pipe movement

volume_categories.typical_use: Very large pipes, pumping mains, high pressure

design_requirements.calculation: Thrust force = Pressure × Pipe cross-sectional area × Factor (based on bend angle)
design_requirements.soil_bearing: Bearing capacity check required (AS 1726 - Geotechnical investigations)
design_requirements.reinforcement: Mesh reinforcement typically required for volumes >0.5m³
design_requirements.australian_standard: AS/NZS 3725 Appendix C - Thrust block design

other_supports.description: Other isolated pipe supports (piers, cradles, hangers)

template_mapping.description: Mapping of Australian civils drainage templates to CESMM4 Classes I, J, K, L

mappings.description: Open channels measured as ducts/culverts (K.5) + concrete lining (Class F)

australian_compliance.erosion_control: IECA Best Practice Erosion and Sediment Control

mappings.description: Excavation (E.2) + fill batters (E.6) + outlet pit (K.2) + outlet pipe (I) + turfing (E.8)

australian_compliance.detention_design: QUDM (Queensland Urban Drainage Manual) or local authority standards

mappings.description: Bulk excavation (E.2) + embankment fill (E.6) + outlet structure (K.2) + outlet pipes (I) + valves (J.8) + landscaping (E.8)

australian_compliance.dam_safety: ANCOLD Guidelines on Dam Safety Management (if >5m height)

mappings.description: In-situ concrete kerb and gutter (Class F) + minor excavation (E.4)

australian_compliance.profile_standard: AS/NZS 3725 Appendix D - Kerb and gutter profiles

standards_references.AS_3500_2: Plumbing and drainage - Sanitary plumbing and drainage

standards_references.AS_3680: Guide to the application of coatings to metal pipelines

environmental_compliance.EPA_permits: Watercourse crossings, discharge permits, contaminated land

environmental_compliance.waste_tracking: Classification per AS 4439.3, tracking for contaminated spoil

depth_triggers.4_0m: Confined space entry procedures, ventilation, gas monitoring

notes: This combined reference covers all drainage and pipework measurement in CESMM4
Classes I-L work together: I=pipes, J=fittings, K=structures, L=installation extras
All rule texts are abbreviated - consult official CESMM4 for complete definitions
Australian Standards provide local compliance framework
Template mapping enables automated CESMM4 code assignment during estimating
